Close to door we see the janitor carrying on his shoulder the Joan Gale figure which he places on a  pedestal in foreground. He carries the figure in such a  position that we see the back of it first, and as he  places it on the pedestal he turns it around so that we  see the face. CAMERA CONCENTRATES for several minutes  on this figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence stares at it, puzzled. Then recognition dawns.  Ralph enters PAST CAMERA and goes to door. He is about  to hurry into museum, when Florence detains him by a  hand on his arm. As she turns, we get the two in  profile. Her expression is one of excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Genius, what're the chances for me  to slip in and give this place the once  over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heard through partly opened door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph! Burton! Are you going to stay out  there all day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drawing door to quietly  and lowering his tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know ... the old man's pretty  peppery right now. Why don't you look in  tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He might get some publicity out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No use. He's a crab, I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks through glass  panel to Igor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Old Santa Claus there? That's easy  for anyone with my sex appeal. He's a  pushover. Watch me stand that old dodo on his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes past Ralph and enters museum, followed by Ralp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nix, Flo -- he won't let you in and  you'll only get me in Dutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horsefeathers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor sees a stranger entering with Ralph and wheels  chair rapidly toward them, speaking as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No visitors allowed! You people will have  to get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, listen, Beaver, I'm from--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting curtly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care where you're from, young  woman. I have said no visitors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He suddenly looks up and sees Charlotte, who enters  museum a bit hesitatingly. Igor stops speaking abruptly  and sits, staring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Charlotte, smiling slightly. Then DOUBLE-EXPOSED  over her figure comes the costume worn by Igor's Marie  Antoinette in the London museum. This FADES IMMEDIATELY  and we see Charlotte as she is, smiling at Igor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: staring, fascinated. CAMERA DRAWS BACK to include the  group again and Ralph notices something strange in  Igor's manner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, Mr. Igor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as though coming  out of a trance)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing -- nothing at all, my boy. I  should like to meet your friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence, taking advantage of the introduction, slips  away, as CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS, and, to avoid suspicion,  looks carefully at several figures during the  following conversation, finally arriving before the  Joan Gale figure, where she stops and studies the  figure carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, certainly, sir. My fiancГ©e. Charlotte,  may I present Mr. Igor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Delighted, I'm sure.  (Igor extends hand to her.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you will forgive this poor, crippled  stump, my dear, I am very happy to know  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs whimsically)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although you would be amused if I were  to tell you that I knew you before you  were born. Before this terrible thing  happened to me ...  (His voice quavers.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I made a very beautiful statue. Even  if I had not met with this disaster, I  could never have hoped to do anything  finer, probably nothing quite so fine.  And, my child, you are that figure come  to life. I wonder, some time, would you  pose for one of my sculptors who does  very excellent work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to, at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence, who seems to have satisfied herself as  to the identity of the figure, turns abruptly  and comes toward them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a woman who craves nourishment.  Let's ankle out of here and find a beanery.  Come on, Moon-struck.  (Takes Charlotte by the arm.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow, who has been hovering in the background,  approaches the group and stands just behind Igor's  chair. As Florence and Charlotte cross to door,  Charlotte smiles back at Igor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be coming to the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At any time. You will always be welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Igor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long, Pop, see you in jail.  Sparrow starts perceptibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two girls exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two girls come from building and are starting toward  corner when Florence, seeing a cab, signals to it. It  swings in to curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Kid, I'm going to leave you flat.  I just thought of something and I've got  to get to the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running a few steps after her  as Florence approaches cab)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about lunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have it for supper.  (Climbs into cab.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long. Cab swings away from curb. Charlotte stands looking  after it, bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo and Ralph return to work. Sparrow stands beside  Igor, who is addressing Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, young man, it is a matter to  astonish one. You are engaged to that  beautiful girl, who was just here. You  have lived close to that beautiful  creature, and yet you produce such  caricatures as this.  (Indicating Ralph's work.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is lovely, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, who seems to be in much better temper than we  have seen him for some time, laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exquisite! But I am going to rechristen  her for you, my friend. She is not to be  Charlotte any more, she is Marie  Antoinette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor points to picture of himself and the figure of  Marie Antoinette. Sparrow, who has been standing near them, comes closer  to Igor, as CAMERA MOVES UP TO CLOSE SHOT. A look of  extreme cunning appears on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is exactly like that statue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picture clearly shown on wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is the soul of that statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if I could have her pose for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS as Hugo laughs knowingly. Sparrow  turns quickly and looks at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tapping himself on forehead, Igor indicates that Hugo is  a little balmy.

dialogues.speaker: EDITOR'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Florence enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Light-o'-my-life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Prussic Acid. What's on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the original pictures of  Joan Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into Dictaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mattie, dig into the morgue and send  up all the art you have on Joan Gale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering through Dictaphone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: A LONG METAL FILING CABINET
dialogues.text: A girl opens compartment marked Ga. Running through files she extracts a number of photographs and walks out of  scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Florence, who is sitting  on edge of his desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, why so mysterious! Come on, spill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can give me an argument and tell  me I'm wrong. Don't be sil, Kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl filing clerk enters and deposits pictures on  desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mattie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Florence has snatched the pictures from the desk and  examines them carefully. Suddenly drops them on desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting to her feet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am right! I know I'm right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no one would ever suspect it. You  don't sound right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence draws chair beside desk, drops into it and  leans over, talking excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jim -- and if you wisecrack while  I'm talking I'll crown you with the inkwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, wise guy. Go ahead. Spill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, there's a little hokey-pokey wax  museum opening up down on 14th Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't that call for an extra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you to keep your trap shut!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you can't blame a guy for getting a  little breathless with a scoop like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises indignantly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, you poor baboon, you can guess  the rest of it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'. What's your idea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just this -- I got a look at that dump a  little while ago and if they haven't got  a wax figure of Joan Gale in that line-up,  then I'm crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll grant that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatiently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the Gale girl, I mean. Where do we  go from there? What of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Jo-jo. Does this mean anything to  you? Joan Gale's body swiped from the  morgue -- Did you ever hear of such a  thing as a death mask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be married to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it came to life and divorced you. I  know all about that. Now my idea is this:  Somebody swipes the girl's body, takes  impression, makes a mold, produces wax  figure ... Bingo! ... Peddles it to this  old skate down there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work that up into a comic strip and  syndicate it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come down to earth. Do you think they  would dare do anything like that? Don't  you think they'd know that figure would  be recognized? Shake your head real hard -- you'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Master Mind.  (Starts toward door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's something cockeyed about that  joint and I'm going to find out what it is. (She gets to the door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, by the way, another pet theory of yours  just blew up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dear, innocent Judge Ramsey that you  were so sure got bumped off for knowing  too much has been located in South America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (With hand on knob)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kiddin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs -- opens door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost! I'll still bet I'm right, and let  you write your own ticket. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte turns a corner and walks briskly TOWARD  CAMERA, finally turning into an apartment about a  quarter of the way down the block. As she disappears  into the building, Sparrow appears around the corner  and, walking past the building she entered, stops and  lights a cigarette, inspecting the building immediately  adjoining the apartment house. There is a large For  Sale or Rent sign on the front of the building, giving  the name and address of the agent handling the property.  Sparrow goes to a basement door and tries it, finding it  locked. He is investigating one of the windows when he  sees that he is observed by a passer-by, and, taking a  notebook from his pocket, apparently copies the name  and address of the realty firm from the sign, and walks  back in the direction from which he came, whistling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth is standing near door. Winton, crossing to him,  hands him a sum of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he counts money  into Worth's hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that squares everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep. Everything settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Well, I'll be seeing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he crosses to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad they didn't hold you downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't have a leg to stand on.  There's no case against me. It's a  clumsy thing to have happen, but  nothing to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, any time I can do anything for  you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. We hear the telephone ring and Winton crosses to answer  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later. Good-by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So long.  (Into phone.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Is this Convict 87 thousand 412  -- and a half? -- Ho-ho, don't swoon. -- This is the voice of the New York Express  broadcasting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello there. Say, I'm awfully glad  you phoned. I wanted to thank you for  trying to cheer me up last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel by now? ... Yeh ... Well,  listen, if you're grateful, you can prove  it and maybe do yourself a good turn at  the same time ... Righto. Now at about  8:30 tonight you be in your car at--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: we saw Sparrow inspecting. Florence passes in front  of building and enters the apartment house adjoining.  CAMERA TRAVELS UP the front of the vacant building to  the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a skylight forced open, the Monster clambers  out onto the roof and creeps stealthily to edge,  peering into lighted window of apartment house. CAMERA  FOLLOWS him. SHOOTING PAST him into room beyond, we see Charlotte just putting the final touches to her toilette, preparing to put on dress. The Monster, gauging the  distance carefully, springs across space separating  buildings and clings to fire escape ladder like a huge  monkey. He leans out from ladder and is about to raise  window sash when the door of the room opens and Florence  enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is dressing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, beautiful, leap into that  loin cloth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no hurry. It's early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting stomach)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't convince the inner woman that we  can wait. She's howling for a bit of  ground beef before we drop in on Santa  Claus and the other dummies. I've only  had a cup of coffee since last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you eat last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch! Eat? You can do a solo if you don't  step on it. I'm going to bow out on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the rush? There's no first act.  They'll all be there and we don't have to  appear at any particular time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry. I'll eat the first child I  see. And I've an appointment with young  Winton at 8:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't get mixed up with that  little rotter, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Give me a chance, baby. Money is  music in my ears, and when his old man  kicks off there'll be a million dollar  tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're going to be indiscreet, I wish  you'd be a little more discreet about it.  Rich men, like Winton, love you and leave  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but they leave you plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monster has returned to the roof of vacant  building. He shows a blind fury at the chance lost, and finally descends through skylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing beside the door is what appears to be a wax  doorman in uniform. There are a number of curious people  looking at the lobby display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him now. Isn't that as real as life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the figure suddenly moves his fingers, jerkily, as  if he were a wax figure, then speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking up and down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step right up, ladies and gentlemen. You  can't afford to miss this exhibition that  has thrilled the monarchs of the world.  For the first time, America is privileged  to see the collection pronounced by art  lovers to be the finest in the world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During this speech Florence and Charlotte enter the  picture and start toward museum door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear music coming from a modern victrola that changes  records by itself. Igor, in wheelchair, is in front of  statue of Sir Walter Raleigh, kneeling on a spreading  velvet cloak on ground before the figure of Queen  Elizabeth, who is smiling at him graciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The history of these figures, my friends,  is more interesting, perhaps, when I tell  you that the originals were destroyed  twelve years ago in a fire in London, and  restored only after years of arduous toil.  To reproduce the figures destroyed I spent  years training men to do the work that I  can no longer do. Some of my workmen have  trained for years before I would let them  undertake a single figure of these groups  that you have been looking at tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been a close shot of Igor and we assume that  he has been addressing a rather large gathering, but as  CAMERA SWINGS we see a pitifully small audience of not  more than ten people.

dialogues.speaker: MAIN ENTRANCE OF MUSEUM
dialogues.text: where Ralph is standing near door to receive visitors.

dialogues.speaker: RALPH
dialogues.text: as Charlotte and Florence enter, he takes a step forward  to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello. You're late.  (Takes a step back from  Charlotte and looks at  her admiringly.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, that's a pretty dress. Have I  ever seen that before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank goodness, that's settled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks directly to the figure she suspects, CAMERA  TRUCKING after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: about four or five buildings removed from entrance.  Winton, in roadster, pulls up to curb and looks up and  down street expectantly. The barker is continuing his  announcement through megaphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor has ended his lecture, and Ralph is escorting a  group of visitors to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hope you have enjoyed seeing these  things tonight. I hope you will tell your  friends for we believe we have something  here of genuine public interest.  (As the last of the visitors  file through the door.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. Thank you. Call again.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: as she inspects the Joan Gale figure. We see that all  doubt has been dispelled and that she is absolutely  sure of her ground. Glancing about quickly, to be sure  she is not observed, she stealthily sticks a pin into  the arm of the figure as if convincing herself it is  made of wax.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF IGOR
dialogues.text: As the last of the visitors are leaving, Sparrow comes  down behind him and, leaning over back of his chair,  whispers something to him. Igor turns sharply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in intense, hushed tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure of that? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd know him anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lose sight of him. This is the  most important thing in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow sees Charlotte and Ralph approaching and signals  Igor to silence. As Sparrow walks away, Ralph and  Charlotte walk toward Igor smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a rather encouraging tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't feel too disappointed at the  slimness of your audience tonight, Mr.  Igor. The weather was against you, and  the people are tired and getting over  their celebration and preparing to go to  work tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite so. Quite so.  (Extending hand to  Charlotte who has been  close beside Ralph.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, my little friend, my little  Marie Antoinette. It is kind of you to be  present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think these things are beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are.  (To Ralph.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boy, I think you are right. Everyone  is tired out today and now that we have  seen my doors open in a new country, I  am beginning to realize that I am a  little tired myself. You can call that  fellow in from the front. I think we'll  close for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. Ralph walks away toward the front door and CAMERA MOVES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should have felt a little  discouraged tonight but now everything  seems quite as it should be. You know,  to find just one person who appreciates  my beautiful children here changes  everything for me. (He glances about to see  that he is not observed,  and continues.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must come some time in the morning  when there are no crowds about and I  can give you more of my time. Florence enters and breaks up the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mr. Igor. I've been  admiring your works. Properly illuminated,  they are more impressive than they were  this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, for a time I despaired of ever  achieving the same effects I had abroad.  And then lighting came to my rescue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was particularly interested in that  group over there.  She points and CAMERA SWINGS TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, that one is very fine. Its drama  seems to interest people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this one, this single figure of  Joan of Arc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That? Yes, that was the most recently  completed. It only arrived this morning.

dialogues.speaker: OTHER CORNER OF SET
dialogues.text: Ralph crosses in front of Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT OF IGOR, FLORENCE AND CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: Showing length of museum and front entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, my friend. Never since these  hands were burned have I created  anything. I have only been able to  direct the work of others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But who did it? Sparrow, who has been standing in background during  the preceding dialogue, listening nervously, now shows  extreme uneasiness as Igor replies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Professor Darcey. He has been my  hands for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shifts nervously and laughs self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deaf and dumb man on scene as Ralph enters. Ralph,  slipping into overcoat, scarf, etc., slaps him on the  back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mute chuckles inanely as Ralph makes his exit.  After Ralph is gone, Hugo takes a black, loose ulster -- a couple of sizes too large -- and hat from the  hook, his clothes resembling those worn by the  Monster. Slipping into them, he exits from cloakroom  and disappears through a rear door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The janitor comes up the steps from Igor's private  workroom. He looks to the entrance to the street and  we see

dialogues.speaker: IGOR
dialogues.text: just bidding good night to Florence, Charlotte and Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: THE JANITOR
dialogues.text: glancing about and feeling that he is unobserved, crosses quickly to the statue of Joan Gale and raises his hand  as though to caress it, when Sparrow appears from behind  another figure, grinning evilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The janitor starts guiltily and slinks quickly out  through rear door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow comes from museum and turns to the right out of  picture, but calls to the others who are still standing  in doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence shows agitated concern in looking after the  retreating figure of Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton, seated in roadster. He catches sight of Florence  and sounds the auto horn. She sees him and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ralph and Charlotte)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people will have to struggle along  without me. There's my heavy date. No  fouling in the clinches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs toward car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence getting into roadster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathlessly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up! Tail that little runt down  the street!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In extreme background we see Sparrow turning a corner,  then we see the car follow quickly and turn the corner  after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS them as they walk down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you'd cut her out and get a  place by yourself.  (Looking after Florence.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why? She's the best friend I've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She isn't anybody's friend, and I don't  like you living with her. She's a bad  influence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nonsense. She's one of the nicest  girls I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's nice about her? ... a hard-boiled  little gold digger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heatedly) I won't let you say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I do say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thinks it's funny to talk the  way she does, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kid yourself -- she means it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we going to have the same quarrel  over again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not quarreling, only ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car, with Winton and Florence, loafing a block in  the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask any questions right now. I  think we're on the trail of hot news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their argument has grown rather heated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, certainly I would. And I'd be  terribly disappointed if you were stupid  enough to object to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't have said that before  you met her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd call it stupid at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's just how stupid I am. When  you go riding, it will be with me. And  if it's with someone else, you can make  it a permanent arrangement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops and draws her  arm away from him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's the way it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way I feel about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you told me. Good night, Mr.  Burton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning, she walks rapidly away. Ralph stands, looking  after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where we saw the mysterious box delivered. Sparrow walks  into picture and rings bell beside door on street level.  After a short pause, the door is opened and he disappears through it. The car carrying Winton and Florence passes  the house and, going to the next corner, stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think this would be as good a  time as any to break the news to me?  What's it all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, as one of the interested parties, I  suppose I might as well tell you the glad  tidings. I think the fellow we've been  following had something to do with the  robbery at the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton shows nervousness and distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look here. It's not up to us to do  our own detective work. I've had enough  trouble over this matter. I don't want  anything more to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even if it gives you a clean bill of  health?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even then. The police are the proper  people to conduct this affair. Now if  you've got any suspicions I'll drive you  to the nearest police station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! And let every rag in town grab a  red-hot story? Not so you could notice it! Now, look, I want you to drive me around  the corner and wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I didn't want to mix in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumping from car)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, brother. Then you can go to  some nice warm place, and I don't mean  California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts back toward Worth's house. Winton overtakes  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I'm sorry. I'll see it through.  What do you want me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you what to do. Drive around the  corner out of sight of the house. I want  to get a closer look at the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts back toward car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth is seated at the desk and Sparrow is standing in  front of him. Worth is speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're yellow to the core -- just yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whimpering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. But I've had the uncanniest  feelin' that someone's been watchin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) Nobody's watching you. You're yellow and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your nerves are gone. And let me tell you,  I'll do nothing to help your nerves until  it's delivered, and you might as well get  that through your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, then, I'll phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the phone on Worth's desk. Worth snatches  it away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not over this phone, you fool! Get  outside to make the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow turns, walks TOWARD CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence comes in and pauses and, glancing quickly up  and down the street, runs down steps to basement door,  which she tries cautiously. Finding it locked, she tries  to peer through window, and finally tries lower sash,  which opens. She climbs through window to basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Winton is waiting. The street door of house opens  and Sparrow appears, starting away in opposite  direction from corner where Winton waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence is feeling her way about. She passes in front  of mirror, sees her own reflection, jumps back, startled, trips and sits down heavily on a pine box that might  contain a coffin. She gasps and springs to her feet,  terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two plain-clothes men approach Winton and address him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, buddy, what's the stall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting for someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, for who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think it concerns you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Winton. Cut out the bluffing.  We've been watching you ever since you  left The Tombs and you've done some  pretty suspicious things. Now what are  you doing here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I done that's suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one thing, you had a visitor at your  apartment today, not exactly the kind of a  person I'd expect you to entertain ... a  person who lives in this block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence is raising up from inspection of box when she  sees the reflection of the Monster in mirror and drops  down behind the box. The figure of the Monster glides  into the room, stands as though listening for a moment  and then disappears in shadows. We hear someone  ascending a flight of rickety stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing down the  street excitedly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to follow that fellow, I tell  you. I've reason to believe he knows  what became of Joan Gale's body. You've  no right to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang onto him, Paul. I'll get the other  bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts off in the direction Winton had pointed. In  extreme background we see Sparrow occasionally as he  passes under an arc lamp. The detective follows him,  walking rapidly. As detective passes Worth's house,

dialogues.speaker: BASEMENT WINDOW
dialogues.text: Florence clambering through and hurrying up the stairs.  She is chattering with fright. She gets to the top of  the stairs, stands and sways, almost falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence running toward Winton and detective. CAMERA FOLLOWS her to a

dialogues.speaker: THE THREE
dialogues.text: Florence grabs Winton by the shoulders and speaks  hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found it! I found the body!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body of Joan Gale!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting a look at Florence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Express. What's the idea, trying  to outsmart the police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seriously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding. Joan Gale's body is  packed in the box in the basement, and  I saw the most horrible thing down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you giving me this straight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take my word for it. Get down there  yourself and give a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer blows police whistle.

dialogues.speaker: SPARROW
dialogues.text: just coming under street lamp. We hear a police whistle  back of him. He turns, looks back, terrified, and darts  away at a quick run.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: back of him, also breaking into a run. We hear the sound  of night stick being struck against the sidewalk and  police whistles from different directions and at various  distances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective, Winton and Florence are approaching.  Several uniformed policemen are running toward them  from both intersecting streets. There is an ad lib  confused babble of voices as a number of curious  people approach the house from several directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Winton)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this skirt out of here! We don't need  hysterics. This thing has to be handled  smoothly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton tries to take Florence away. She tears loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, copper, get a load of this. While  you're chinning yourself on a bar rail, I  run down this story ... my story. Consider  yourself my assistant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you are, you're the only one of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (producing police card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens that I'm the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How quaint. But I can go any place you  can.  (Shows her credentials.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Worth cross the room and go through a door into  an adjoining room. Then we hear a doorbell ring rapidly.  The Monster appears through the door Worth just made an  exit through, comes to the center of the room and stands  listening. Evidently they become tired of ringing, with  no response, for we hear them start to batter in the  door. The Monster turns and vanishes quickly the way he  came. We hear the door shattered and, after a moment's  pause, an officer appears stealthily, with drawn  revolver, around the hall door of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody here, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (peering through door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, take it easy. Let's get some light  on here.  (Officer flashes flashlight  in search of switch.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls into hallway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple of you fellows get upstairs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Off scene)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear them ascending the stairs. Officer crosses and  gingerly opens door of room that the Monster disappeared  through, flashes light about and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is only the one entrance door, and the window  of the room, when the officer examines it with flashlight appears to be flat against the brick wall of the  adjoining house. The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective, evidently finding switch, has thrown on  lights. He is talking to Florence and Winton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a description of the  person you saw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a very good one, I guess. He wasn't  like anything human. He hobbled and swayed  like a monkey, and the face, from the  glimpse I got of it in the light from the  street, was like an African war mask.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean he was colored?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what he was, but he made  Frankenstein look like a lily!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer comes in from the adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's nothing on this floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the men descending stairs from floor above. The  detective steps to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find anything up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off scene -- as of  someone approaching)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- not even any furniture up there --  a lot of old papers and junk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two uniformed policemen enter from hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any rear entrance to this place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't find any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's give the basement a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers and detective, with Florence and Winton,  approach basement door and cautiously start to descend  steps to basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two uniformed men enter and flash lights everywhere. One  of them tries door to rear room. It opens. They turn back and shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights come on as though switch were thrown on other  side of partition. Florence, Winton and two detectives  enter, followed by the two uniformed policemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to the box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! You'll find Joan Gale in  that box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinks back against  wall and gasps)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- No -- I -- I -- I don't want to see it.  (Starts toward door. )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute! You stay right where you are.  (To one of the policemen  as he sees a small hatchet  on a table.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get that hatchet and open this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One officer gets the hatchet and the others drag the  box a little nearer the center of the room and they  start to pry off the lid. As they pull one nail, it  comes out with a mournful shriek. Florence almost falls  over a smaller box in her effort to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, what wouldn't I give for a slug of gin! With a terrific ripping sound, they finally succeed in  removing the lid. Everybody crowds forward to peer at  what they believe to be a corpse, as CAMERA COMES TO A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: its contents revealed to be row on row of bottles of  Scotch whiskey. An officer's hand comes in and lifts out  a bottle. CAMERA DRAWS BACK TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sinking back onto box,  extending hands and wiggling fingers) Oh, gimme, gimme!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a general shout of laughter and the basement  door opens and the second detective enters, driving  Sparrow ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blubbering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't done nothin' -- you ain't got no  right to arrest me! What's the charge  against me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective slaps his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, who owns this layout? Come on, spill  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I was never here before  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slaps him again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know, oh ... You don't know  anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. All I know is there was a fellow  named Worth--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, that was his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my bootlegger's name! Was he a  heavyset fellow, with a stubby moustache?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, that's the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope he delivered the stuff I paid him  for this afternoon.  (Then, remembering --  to detective.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you it was a bootlegger you saw  at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to one of the  uniformed policemen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, take this fellow in. One of the policemen leads Sparrow out roughly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he goes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't done nothin'. I wouldn't even  deliver some stuff for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence starts piling bottles of whiskey on her arm  like an armload of cordwood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what do you think you're doing? Put  that stuff back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing doing. This is my percentage. You  birds are going to get yours. And anyhow,  I found this dump.  She exits, followed by Winton. There is a general laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SHOWING PRECINCT NUMERALS
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK showing Winton seated in car near entrance. A policeman is taking Sparrow up the steps.  CAMERA FOLLOWS them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant looks up as policeman and Sparrow enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Junky, eh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh -- peddling.  (To Sparrow.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put up your hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow holds up his hands. The policeman searches him,  laying articles from his pocket on desk before sergeant.  Among the articles is a very handsome watch. The  sergeant looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A classy turnip. Must have dipped it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lays it on desk with a pile of other things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain is seated at desk. He is laughing heartily at  Florence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imagine my embarrassment. The razzing I'm  going to get is nobody's business. I tail  a corpse and stumble on a box full of  spirits and not a dead one in the layout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell me your managing editor is  poison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poison! It takes a sturdy person to look

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both laughing as the door opens and the  policeman enters, leading Sparrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to talk to this fellow, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing at Sparrow  contemptuously)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's all right, Denny. He's a junky.  He'll talk in a little while. Just lock  him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  (To Sparrow.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  He leads Sparrow out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have not seen, up to this point, anything that would  give us a clue as to the location of this room, which  we now see for the first time. It is a stone room, with  apparently but one opening through a trap in the ceiling, which is approached by a spiral stairway. There are  several huge vats of some steaming liquid, a few pieces  of dilapidated furniture and an embalming table in the  center of the room. The Monster descends steps, carrying the body of a man,  wrapped in burlap. He places it on table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the season's best catch is out  there waiting in his Rolls-Royce. I  guess I'll breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you ought to get a good laugh  story out of it, anyhow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens. A man in uniform, but hatless, enters  quickly and, coming to desk, lays the watch taken from  Sparrow before the captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think this is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeh, but do you know whose watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's break down and confess -- we don't  know anything about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer opens the back of the watch and holds it so  that she can read the inscription on inner case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judge Ramsey's! That's all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching out for it quickly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not kiddin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did this come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just took it off that junky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great! Get him down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton seated in car. Florence runs down steps and  climbs into car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office! There's not much traffic --  you can step on it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as car pulls away from curb)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like taking chances, don't you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go in for dangerous things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darned if I don't!  (Reaches over quickly with  left hand and pulls  steering wheel.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing narrowly averted collision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down to ninety. I said the office,  not the cemetery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. I mean what I'm saying. I  never believed there were women like you  in the world. You're game and decent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They narrowly miss striking another car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and so determined to live that I'm  going to get out and take a taxi if you  don't watch where you're going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose this is going to sound absurd.  I've only known you twenty-four hours, but  I'm in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't usually take that long, but  I'll forgive you -- you were in a tough  spot when I met you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really -- I'm crazy about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, is that what caused it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me. You think I'm  just talking. Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money have you got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven knows. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that being the case, I'll take it  up with the board of directors. Hey,  listen, aviator, here we are!  The car swings into the reporter's entrance of the  Express Building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold everything. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The editor is just finishing phone conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right. Give that a four-point head.  No, that's all it's worth ... All right,  you can play it up later if ...  Door opens and Florence comes in, breathless, extends  hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mit me, kid. I've got a classic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at her with a  melancholy expression)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You here again like an evil spirit to  mar my happiness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's a story, but I'm not going to  tell you what it is. Every time I tell  you anything it goes haywire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean -- haywire? You start  out after murderers and come back with  three-for-a-dime bootleggers. You start  to solve murder mysteries and break up  crap games. You're grand! I'm for you!  Stupendous!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (steps toward his desk  belligerently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, you're always razzing everything I  do, but this is one time I'm in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on, little girl, take your troubles  somewhere else. I don't feel like  talking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was there any art on Judge Ramsey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What goofy idea have you got now? Don't  tell me you suspect Judge Ramsey of  stealing the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (goes to door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make you eat dirt, you soap  bubble! I'm going to make you beg for  somebody to help you let go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow is seated in the center of the room, quivering  for want of the drug. A number of detectives, in  shirt-sleeves, evidently worn and tired themselves,  are circling about the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you found the watch in a taxi cab three  months ago. Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I got in the cab and it was  layin' there on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you going when you got in  that cab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. Not so very far--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remember what day that was, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. About three months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember what kind of a cab it was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. Just a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't happen to be going to Worth's  place, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, I'm sure it wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You used to go to Worth's place a whole  lot. What makes you sure it wasn't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe it was. I don't remember.  (Sparrow slips from chair  to knees, sobbing.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to do something for me, I can't  stand it any longer -- I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's beginning to break now -- he'll talk  pretty soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about that -- he's been  begging all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks out of window and we see that it is almost daylight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly half past eight. I never saw a  junky hold out like this before.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MUSEUM THE NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: The people passing are of the type who would be hurrying  to report for some office or clerical job around nine  o'clock. Charlotte walks into picture, glances up and  down street as though looking for someone, then glances  at watch and goes to museum door, peering through panel.  She tries the door and finds it open and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody is in scene. Charlotte enters, looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph! Are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no answer and she starts down the length of  the museum, occasionally calling "Ralph." As she passes  a niche in the wall that contains a half figure of Dante  on the platform, the CAMERA MOVES TO CLOSE-UP of that  figure. The artificial lids are raised and we see the  eyes of a living person peering through and watching  her progress. Over this we hear her calling "Ralph"  again, but the call is growing fainter. The lids drop  back into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is near portieres which conceal door to  workshop at rear. She draws curtains aside and steps  into workshop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo is at work. Charlotte has advanced several steps int the room before she becomes aware of his presence. She  stops, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon -- Is Ralph here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no response as Hugo does not hear her. She  advances a step farther, when he turns and grins at  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo, still grinning, takes a step toward her and makes  the hideous sound identified with deaf-mutes. She starts  to back away from him, terrified. Backing toward portiere followed by Hugo, she suddenly turns and darts through th curtains. Her momentum carries her almost to Igor, who is approaching in wheelchair. She extends both her hands to  him delightedly. He starts to respond, then, catching sig of his crippled claws, drops them into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Mr. Igor! -- I'm so glad you're here  -- I don't know why I should be, but I was  a little bit afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! So, my little friend, you have honored  me by accepting my invitation of last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I -- wanted to speak to Ralph. We  had a silly argument last night and I said  something unkind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs in a tender,  fatherly way)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you children, you happy children.  You've quarreled and now you're going to  be friends again. And that is as it should  be. Never let any stupid misunderstandings  come between you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it was really my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he will probably demand the life of  anyone who agrees with you. Let him think  it was his fault ... He should be along  very shortly .. . But be very stern  before you forgive him, especially if it  is your fault  ...  While you're waiting  for your friend, would you like to see  some new figures I have downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FOLLOWS them as Igor wheels to top of stairs  leading to studio and workshop below. He takes crutches  and struggles painfully to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Mr. Igor, I'm terribly ashamed. I shouldn't have put you to so much  trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chuckles gently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is no trouble at all, my child. This  is the strange, vicarious pleasure that  remains for me -- to see others enjoy  the beauty I used to create.  (He attempts to descend  first step, then says,  good-naturedly.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My footing is not too secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte rushes to his assistance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, let me help you, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte helps him descend stairs.

dialogues.speaker: WORKSHOP TOWARD STAIRS
dialogues.text: We see Charlotte and Igor finish descending steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you -- thank you, my dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte precedes Igor into room and stands glancing  about. Igor enters, closes the door quickly and locks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor instantly drops his crutches and sweeps Charlotte  into his arms, lifting her clear off the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marie Antoinette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte screams and struggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go! Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have found immortality, you and I.  You must not be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph! Ralph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears at Igor's face and rips away the mask and  beard, which bring with them the skillfully designed  wig that is attached to them, revealing the horribly  mutilated face of the Monster. Charlotte screams and  faints. Igor deposits her tenderly on a couch and  kneels beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor, kneeling beside the girl, speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor, frightened child. The only common  objective of all living things is death  ... and she is afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janitor is sweeping walk. Ralph comes into picture,  glances into museum and, assuming that he is the  first to arrive, takes a last puff on a cigarette  before entering. He throws it away and starts to  enter when we hear Florence's voice off scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- Ralph!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up and we see that he recognizes someone  approaching, as Winton's car whirls up to the curb  and Florence jumps out, followed by Winton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you people doing out in the  middle of the night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm after news, as usual. I wonder if it  would be all right for me to slip in and  look around your factory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so. But wouldn't it be better for  you to wait until the old man's here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you a secret. I kinda  like the old gent and I'm trying to  build a special Sunday Magazine story  out of him. It might help him a whole  lot. But that's a side issue -- something  I do on my own time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (boyishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee, that's great. After the bad opening  that night the old boy was pretty blue.  This will pep him up. Have you told him  about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wanted to do it without saying  anything. I think he's worth it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A policeman walks up to car and calls over to group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose car is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- You can't park there. You'll  have to take it down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going to car and  climbing back to wheel)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, brother.  (Shouts to Florence.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flo, I've got to find a place to park.  I'll be right back.  CAMERA ANGLE WIDENS taking in Ralph and Florence at museum door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waves to Winton -- calls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't deceive me or I'll come back and  haunt you.  Winton's car moves away. Ralph unlocks the door, and  he and Florence enter the museum. Ralph throws away  cigarette. Janitor picks it up and stands leaning on  broom, puffing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence takes from her bag a photograph of Judge Ramsey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showing bust picture of man whose features are strikingly like those of Voltaire, although he has a moustache,  wears glasses and is dressed in modern clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRUCKS AFTER her as she goes from one figure to another, finally stopping in front of the figure of  Voltaire. This she studies, in profile, full-face  three-quarter view, etc., and finds by comparison  that the two are identical. (We CUT back and forth  several times from the photograph to the statue.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the photo and  wax figure; she is nervously biting her  fingernails)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, come here a minute, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to her and  notices her biting nails)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better cut that out.  (Points to figure of  Venus de Milo.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what happens to girls who bite  their nails.  (Florence ignores the remark.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hugo passes them at this moment. Florence watches  Hugo suspiciously as if she did not want him to know  what she is referring to. She waits until he has  passed into the cloakroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this photograph, will you?  (Handing Ralph photograph.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparrow suddenly springs to his feet, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right -- I'll talk! I'll tell you  what I know!  (He is a madman.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ramsey was murdered because he looked  like Voltaire!  (He laughs wildly.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he looked like Voltaire! You want  to know what became of him! He's a statue -- a silly wax statue!  (Laughs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed him!  (Catches Sparrow roughly, wheels  him around, slaps his face.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on with the rest of it. You killed  him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I didn't. It was Igor at the  waxworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slapping him again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were in on it -- you worked for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- the only thing I did for him was  to keep track of the man named Worth  that runs the place where you arrested  me tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Igor at the Wax Museum! You'll find  your judge embalmed in wax! He's a statue  of Voltaire, with all the other corpses!  The whole place is a morgue -- do you  hear? -- a morgue!  (Laughs.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte is crouched, terrified, in a corner, while  Igor, now a raving maniac, tries to calm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child, why are you crouched there?  So pitifully afraid. Immortality has been  the dream, the inspiration of our kind,  and I am going to give you the only  guarantee of immortality you have ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte shrinks further into the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, oh, please, I haven't done  anything to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in bewildered,  plaintive tone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I have no desire to hurt you. You  will always be beautiful. Think, my  child, in a thousand years you will  be as lovely as you are now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph is holding the photograph, and he and Florence  stand looking at the figure. We see that the features  of the two are identical. Then we hear a muffled scream.  Florence and Ralph look at each other inquiringly and  stand waiting for the scream to be repeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monster is pleading with Charlotte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My child, my child, if you will just  listen to me, then you will not be  afraid. Don't you understand, dear,  that I love you? Don't you know that  at times when I have wanted to die -- I could not die because I had not  saved you. And now you are here, to  be given, a thing of delight, to all  the world. I am trying to grant you  immortality.  Charlotte is just a terrified, half-hypnotized, crumpled  mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fiend! You fiend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor backs away from her, gesturing with his arms as  if to ward off a blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my Marie Antoinette, you must not  say that to me. There was a fiend, of  that you may be sure. There was a fiend
(suddenly extends  hands toward her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and this is what that monstrous person  did to me.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLOTTE
dialogues.text: as she drops her head on her knees, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers pour out and climb into two cars. They  commandeer a couple of taxis and all race down the  street, with sirens screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Igor standing over Charlotte pityingly, wringing his hand Then he whirls toward curtained cabinet in rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You! ... You did this!  (To Charlotte, as he  crosses toward cabinet.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These terrible broken hands -- this  terrible living dead man -- for twelve  years, twelve awful years, has hunted  for the fiend, the fiend who brought  us here tonight! But the account is  closed.  (He sweeps aside  curtain covering cabinet.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cabinet, full length, erect, is the wax-embalmed  figure of Worth, which falls forward stiffly, landing  with a thud. Charlotte gives a piercing, terrified  scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence and Ralph hear scream repeated and rush to  stairs. CAMERA FOLLOWS them as they run to stairs and  start down. They find door locked. Ralph throws his  full weight against the door several times. When the  door shatters he stumbles into room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look around, startled. It is apparently untenanted.  As they stand looking at each other in bewilderment, the scream is repeated. Ralph gestures, "Wait a minute,"  then, with emphasis:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It did come from under our feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching about, he finds a trap door, which he opens  and looks down, and sees:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Charlotte on operating table. The Monster is  stirring a huge vat of boiling wax. Hearing the trap  door open, he looks up, sees Ralph and screams his  rage. Ralph passes CAMERA and starts downstairs toward  him.

dialogues.speaker: FLORENCE
dialogues.text: Standing at trap, looking down, horrified. She whirls  and dashes, screaming, upstairs toward the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph and the Monster having a furious struggle, the  Monster attempting to force the boy backward into one  of the vats of boiling wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence appears at head of stairs from below, just as  Winton enters door. She runs to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Quick! Help!  As they descend the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ask any questions. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Monster succeeds in striking Ralph over the head  with some heavy object. As Ralph sinks, stunned, to  the floor, the Monster dashes up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT FROM HORROR CHAMBER CAMERA TIPPED UP SHA
dialogues.text: Showing trap at head of stairs. When the Monster has  negotiated three-quarters of the ascent, we see Winton  appear in the trap door above, blocking his escape.  Now we hear the screaming of the sirens of approaching  police cars. Seeing his passage barred, the Monster,  no longer coherent, stands jabbering like an infuriated  ape at the man above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton at edge of trap, looking down, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do something! Can't you? Do something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winton draws back. Florence turns, runs back toward  museum, screaming. We hear the tramping of feet on the  floor above and then see the feet and legs of first  officer descending stairs.

dialogues.speaker: SHOT UPWARD FROM HORROR CHAMBER
dialogues.text: As Winton draws from trap, the Monster starts to advance. A policeman in uniform appears above him, with drawn  revolver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get 'em up! Don't move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He commences a cautious descent of the stairs. CAMERA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ralph, who has recovered, gather Charlotte in  his arms and whirl her so that his body would shield  her from a possible stray bullet. The Monster, who is  backing, still defiant, before the policeman, misses  his footing and, with an agonizing scream, whirls  downward into a vat of boiling wax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A great crowd is collecting. The police are holding  them back. They lead the janitor and Hugo from the  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think these mugs mean anything,  but take them around and get a statement  from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An officer leads them away. Florence runs through crowd  with Winton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Florence and Winton scramble in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, pal, get me uptown!  (Breathlessly.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop for lights -- don't stop for--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph is leading Charlotte, still hysterical, through  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the room is clearly discernible, we hear the  clatter of typewriters. A scene of feverish activity.  Copy boys are dashing back and forth. The place is  seething with excitement. Florence, seated at machine  nearest CAMERA, is typing frantically. She evidently  just completes the last line of story, jerks sheet  from machine and hands it to a copy boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it away, Hennessy.  (Springs to her feet.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is bedraggled, hair hanging in her eyes, evidently  exhausted. She reels toward the editor's room. Several  desk workers spring up and surround her, traveling a  part of the distance with her. They are thumping her  playfully on the back and talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hat's off to you, kid. What a scoop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This story makes history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Flo. You've got the  other papers bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Now I'm going to scramble this egg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Points toward door marked Managing Editor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up as Florence enters room. She is gloating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Poison Ivy, how about it? Was that  a story?  He looks up sourly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lousy! You had a million dollars worth  of luck.  She looks at him indignantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, stupid, could I do anything  that would possibly meet with your  approval?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you could. Cut out this rotten  business and act like a lady. Marry me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears the honking of an automobile in the street  below and walks to the window, looks down for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in front of the Express Building, honking impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Florence turns back from window, grins at editor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get even with you, you dirty  stiff! I'll do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises and catches her in his arms. As they embrace,  we hear the raucous "honk-honk" of the car in the street  below.
